meanings.definition: A person who shucks oysters or clams.
meanings.sent1: The shuckers at the seafood restaurant were skilled at opening oysters.
meanings.sent2: The shuckers worked quickly to open the fresh clams for the customers.
meanings.sent3: The shuckers had a friendly competition to see who could shuck the most oysters in an hour.
meanings.sent4: The shuckers' hands moved like lightning as they expertly opened the oysters.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the shuckers at work filled the air with a rhythmic clinking.

meanings.definition: A tool used for shucking oysters or clams.
meanings.sent1: The chef grabbed the shuckers to open the stubborn oyster shell.
meanings.sent2: The shiny shuckers gleamed under the kitchen lights.
meanings.sent3: The old shuckers had been passed down through generations of seafood lovers.
meanings.sent4: The shuckers were like magic wands, effortlessly revealing the hidden pearls inside.
meanings.sent5: The sharp edge of the shuckers made quick work of the oyster shells.
